channel.title: Is being a knight a death sentence?
channel.description:
I was just in a game where, after telling a prince who jailed me night 2 that I'm a knight, he immediately outs me day 3 and everyone basically hangs me then and there.
If this is the way knights are, then this is a useless class, for what is one supposed to do? No one's going to be waiting for the knight to prove himself via Cold Steel (especially since there might not be anyone suspicious to CS).
So, what, stay quiet and hope no one targets you? Doesn't sound like a fun idea for a game. Claim something else and lie as Blue Dragon? Doesn't seem very smart.
So what's the deal with this class?

item.title: Is being a knight a death sentence?
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
we should break Obs’ follow back into two parts if we want to make that remotely just as claimable as Knight

Read full topic
item.source: Is being a knight a death sentence?

item.title: Is being a knight a death sentence?
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
That works too, my point is whatever the case, making the hard to trust classes easier to trust puts things in the wrong direction. The last thing we want is to make get all claims open or to one person and solve the game by executing the 5 people with easy to fake claims a better strategy than it already is.

Read full topic
item.source: Is being a knight a death sentence?

item.title: Is being a knight a death sentence?
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Or we can just add more classes that are hard to confirm?

Read full topic
item.source: Is being a knight a death sentence?

item.title: Is being a knight a death sentence?
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Marinne:

we need to rework the knight to make it easier for BD to trust

I’d say the exact oposite, if anything we need to re-work more classes to make them harder for BD to trust. Not enough good claims is certainly one of the game’s larger problems right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Is being a knight a death sentence?

item.description:
Same. I typically make a high profile of myself then self-tornado around with suspicious people as a CW and I’ve caused more Prince deaths than I’d like to admit.

Read full topic
item.source: Is being a knight a death sentence?

item.title: Is being a knight a death sentence?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
3 reasons in my mind why my claim is true in most situations:

1: If you are scum fake claiming Knight successfully then you are not expected to get information or produce feedback later on (much like with King)
2: If you are BD Knight confirmed then you have a sword to use as leverage against people to get them to listen and a shield to keep your main supporters alive
3: Getting confirmed as Knight is easiest if you are a skilled player who can properly take advantage of the Knight’s power in the first place

Read full topic
item.source: Is being a knight a death sentence?

item.title: Is being a knight a death sentence?
item.dc:creator: Twil1ight
item.description:
But for real talk. If you’re paying attention to chat as Knight then you don’t have usually issues by confirming yourself as Knight by protecting somebody and write in Deathnote.

Read full topic

That’s called a “Muwaha, I was so undercover that I kept it even from myself to do this brilliant play”.

item.title: Is being a knight a death sentence?

item.description:
I know this for a fact.Lemme explain it.I guarded and killed reaper’s one soul n1 but no one believes it sure.And prince upped me d5 and get me exed bcs i didn’t cs someone.He told me after i get exed he said you should have cs’ed.So listen my post above
